channel.title: Fake player?
channel.description:
i have a idea. and its to make a "Fake" player..
Like a character that logs in when the server is started. But i cnt seem to find anything that helps me in the right way.
Can someone help me?

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

What we mean is creating an NPC using the player interface. No networking would be performed on this object as all attributes would be set internally and then sent to other players.

Read full topic

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:23, topic:547690”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=666595.msg4457443#msg4457443 date=1415712230]

lare96 is stupid

I don’t think you have any room to be talking about intelligence.

No, but it’s common sense that a socket isn’t needed to create a fake player. In fact you can just create a new player object, any socket calls can just be ignored. Just update the players absolutly.
[/quote]
i was referring to controlling the fake player, like a bot or something (assuming that’s what the OP wants). a socket is needed to do that (play animations, graphics, forced text, walking, etc. all apart of updating, updating is a packet that’s sent to the client through a socket)

im really not getting what you guys are trying to say, im not trying to be stubborn but ive tried creating a “fake player” the way you guys are proposing and it didn’t work (i didn’t expect it to either) unless im misinterpreting something

have any of you guys even TRIED to do what you’re proposing? Lol[/quote]
No, the server should already handle that for the other clients. You don’t need sockets for the fake player.

Read full topic

im really not getting what you guys are trying to say, im not trying to be stubborn but ive tried creating a “fake player” the way you guys are proposing and it didn’t work (i didn’t expect it to either) unless im misinterpreting something

have any of you guys even TRIED to do what you’re proposing? Lol

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:

[quote=“tyb97, post:20, topic:547690”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=666595.msg4457327#msg4457327 date=1415659672]
lare96 is stupid
[/quote]
I don’t think you have any room to be talking about intelligence.[/quote]
No, but it’s common sense that a socket isn’t needed to create a fake player. In fact you can just create a new player object, any socket calls can just be ignored. Just update the players absolutly.

Read full topic

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

lare69:

nope, you need a socket to create the player object. try it yourself.

You have access to the server, you can change the player object.

[quote=“lare69, post:16, topic:547690”]do you know how runescape servers work? to create the player object in the first place YOU NEED A SOCKET. how are you going to send the player updating packet to even play animations, graphics, etc. in the first place without a socket…

what you’re basically saying with “why would you need sockets?” is like saying “why would you need a client to play on a server?”

the client has a socket that it uses to communicate with the server, and the server has a socket for every player that it uses to communicate with the client. don’t believe me? try your code on any server without using a socket, won’t work. how do I know? i’ve tried doing that before when i didn’t know about how networking worked[/quote]

Like I said earlier, wrap the Player class and stub any calls to the socket. This will give you an object you can register with the world, and from there handle the AI yourself.

[code]import server.models.players.Client;

public class AIPlayer extends Client {
public AIPlayer(String name, int id) {
super(null, id);
this.playerName = name;
}

@Override
public void flushOutstream() {
    outStream.currentOffset = 0;
}

}[/code]
PI is a terrible server to try and do this on. The netcode was never separated from the player logic

Read full topic

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

The player object would be local to the server itself so no socket would need to be established, you would play the animations server sided, and player updating would take care of that for the rest of the players.

Read full topic

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:16, topic:547690”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666595.msg4457135#msg4457135 date=1415558274]

ummmm what are you all talking about?

create a socket and connect the socket to your server, you can then use that socket to send data to do things like walk and talk (to control the player). that would be the only way to create an actual “fake” player that’s logged in on the server

Only reason you need to do that is if you plan on having some form of a client or control panel or etc controling the bot.
[/quote]
nope, you need a socket to create the player object. try it yourself.

ok show me doing something like this without using any sockets :rolleyes:

Don’t be a dick :palm:

Why would you need sockets?

…

Please enlighten us all and explain why the above wouldn’t work? “:rolleyes:”

do you know how runescape servers work? to create the player object in the first place YOU NEED A SOCKET. how are you going to send the player updating packet to even play animations, graphics, etc. in the first place without a socket…

what you’re basically saying with “why would you need sockets?” is like saying “why would you need a client to play on a server?”

the client has a socket that it uses to communicate with the server, and the server has a socket for every player that it uses to communicate with the client. don’t believe me? try your code on any server without using a socket, won’t work. how do I know? i’ve tried doing that before when i didn’t know about how networking worked[/quote]

So you make a bot object that doesn’t need a socket because no data is sent or received…

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:12, topic:547690”][quote author=lare69 link=topic=666595.msg4457079#msg4457079 date=1415518659]
ummmm what are you all talking about?

create a socket and connect the socket to your server, you can then use that socket to send data to do things like walk and talk (to control the player). that would be the only way to create an actual “fake” player that’s logged in on the server
[/quote]
Only reason you need to do that is if you plan on having some form of a client or control panel or etc controling the bot.[/quote]
nope, you need a socket to create the player object. try it yourself.

Ambokile:

[quote author=lare69 link=topic=666595.msg4457169#msg4457169 date=1415575230]ok show me doing something like this without using any sockets :rolleyes:

Don’t be a dick :palm:

Why would you need sockets?

…

Please enlighten us all and explain why the above wouldn’t work? “:rolleyes:”[/quote]
do you know how runescape servers work? to create the player object in the first place YOU NEED A SOCKET. how are you going to send the player updating packet to even play animations, graphics, etc. in the first place without a socket…

what you’re basically saying with “why would you need sockets?” is like saying “why would you need a client to play on a server?”

the client has a socket that it uses to communicate with the server, and the server has a socket for every player that it uses to communicate with the client. don’t believe me? try your code on any server without using a socket, won’t work. how do I know? i’ve tried doing that before when i didn’t know about how networking worked

Read full topic

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

lare69:

ok show me doing something like this without using any sockets :rolleyes:

Don’t be a dick :palm:

Why would you need sockets?

[code=Java]public class Player {

public Player(String name, PlayerType type) {
    this.name = name;
    this.type = type;

    for (Skill s : Skill.values()) {
        this.setSkill(s, 1);
    }
    Server.playerList.add(this);
}

public void updatePlayers() {
    for (Player p : Server.playerList) {
        queueAnimationUpdate(p, p.getAnimationId());
        // Player updating here
    }
}

}[/code]

If your server is structured in any way like the above (which I presume it is) then you could add a “fake” player to the server simply by doing something like this:

if (command.equals("add_player")) { String name = args[0]; Player p = new Player(name, PlayerType.BOT); p.setAppearance(Appearance.random()); p.setSkill(Skill.STRENGTH, 40); p.setAnimation(Animation.DANCE, AnimationDuration.LOOP_FOREVER); p.setGraphic(Graphic.STUN, GraphicDuration.LOOP_FOREVER); p.setEquipment(EquipmentSlot.HAND, new Item(Item.BRONZE_SWORD, 1)); p.setChat("flash:wave:hi!"); }

Please enlighten us all and explain why the above wouldn’t work? “:rolleyes:”

Read full topic

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

lare69:

ok show me doing something like this without using any sockets :rolleyes:

Just simply create a class that wraps around Player and replaces all write calls to the socket with a stub. Register said player with your server, and use AI to handle his actions. It really isn’t that hard to do

Read full topic

[/quote]

No it’s not - you could do all that server-sided without any sockets.[/quote]
ok show me doing something like this without using any sockets :rolleyes:

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

tyb97:

Remember Jagex also made some Player NPC’s, which had the right-click options identical to other players, this would be a better way as you wouldn’t have to worry about the networking pitfalls. You could even write a simple AI for this NPC, make it walk to certain locations, maybe preform certain animations, etc.

http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/Player_spoof

Read full topic

item.title: Fake player?
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:547690”][quote author=Quintorz link=topic=666595.msg4457009#msg4457009 date=1415475948]

it’s been done before and it’s not that easy if you’re a beginner

i wont consider myself a beginner. i just need a point in the right direction
[/quote]
Create a player object after the server is initialized, just, don’t allow the “bot” player object to send packets to it’s “client”. As, er, there’s no client for it…
You can make them send messages and what not but I mean, sending configs would be useless since there’s nothing to read them…[/quote]

^^ That’s pretty much it but you do need to know some knowledge of networking to make something like this. If this is too hard you can always use a NPC.

Read full topic
